item.title: Bangladeshi state TV headquarters put on fire, 'many' trapped inside
item.description: Protestors in Bangladesh set the state TV headquarters on fire amid demonstrations against the Sheikh Hasina government's decision on job quotas. The incident occurred on Thursday, causing fears that many may be trapped inside the building. An official from the station reported that hundreds of protesters stormed the premises and set ablaze at least 60 vehicles and an office building. "They first torched a police post at Rampura after police opened fire at them," he said, referring to a neighborhood in the capital, Dhaka.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ursula von der Leyen re-elected as European Commission president
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: EU chief Ursula von der Leyen gets another 5-year term
item.description: European Union (EU) chief Ursula von der Leyen secured another five-year term as president of the European Commission after winning support from EU lawmakers on Thursday. The 720-member European Parliament approved her with 401 votes in favour, 284 against, and 15 abstentions. Von der Leyen needed 361 votes to pass. Her selection comes at the same time as the arrival of recently elected Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, Keir Starmer.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: EU chief puts defence, industry at heart of re-election pitch
item.description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen on Thursday made her final pitch to win EU lawmakers' backing for a second term, vowing to bolster Europe's defence and strengthening its industry through greater investment. She vowed to boost Europe's competitiveness and ensure significant investment in key industries including defence.

item.title: India put to 'unjustified pressure' due to energy ties with Russia: Russian FM
item.description: Sergey Lavrov criticized the pressure on India over energy ties with Russia, addressing Zelenskyy's remarks about Modi's visit and a hospital strike. He also condemned the Ukrainian ambassador, praised Indiaâ€™s autonomy, and Jaishankar's strategy to secure food and fertilizer by purchasing oil from multiple sources despite Western displeasure towards China and India.

item.title: EU Parliament to decide on second term for Commission chief von der Leyen
Democrats attack Trump running mate J D Vance's past comments on abortion
Man who smuggled military tech to Russia sentenced to 3 years in US jail
Bangladesh quota protesters announce nationwide shutdown today, PM Hasina 'regrets' casualties
item.description: Student protesters advocating for reforms in the government job quota system have declared a nationwide shutdown for Thursday, following incidents involving security forces that resulted in the deaths of six people, including four students, nationwide. Asif Mahmud, a leading coordinator of the movement, announced on Facebook that all establishments, except hospitals and emergency services, will shut down, with only ambulance services allowed to operate.

item.title: US union organizing, and unions' election win rate, is surging, NLRB says
item.description: Recent data from the National Labor Relations Board reveals a surge in union election petitions, with over 2,600 filed this fiscal year, exceeding the previous year's total. Unions have seen a 32% increase in petitions, winning 79% of elections they pursued, up from 76% last year. Despite these gains, union representation among US workers remains historically low. Experts attribute the rise in organizing efforts to pandemic concerns and regulatory shifts favoring unions under the Biden administration.

item.title: US military ends Gaza floating pier mission to bring aid to Palestinians by sea
Joe Biden says Kamala Harris could lead if his health declines
item.description: President Joe Biden, addressing ongoing concerns about his age and ability to serve, stated his willingness to transfer power to Vice President Kamala Harris if health issues prevent him from completing a potential second term. In a BET interview, Biden emphasized that such a scenario is unlikely unless a medical condition arises, which he currently does not have. Acknowledging the legitimacy of concerns about his age, Biden, 81, defended his capability to lead and expressed confidence in serving another four years.

item.title: Nancy Pelosi told Biden that he could destroy Democrats' chances of winning: Report
item.description: Former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi reportedly cautioned President Joe Biden that current polling indicates he may not defeat Donald Trump in the upcoming election. Biden pushed back, citing conflicting polls, and Pelosi sought input from advisor Mike Donilon. While Pelosi did not explicitly suggest Biden drop out, she emphasized the urgency of his decision. The exchange underscores Democratic uncertainties ahead of 2024. Pelosi, now in California, has not spoken to Biden since.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Pass the torch': Top Democrat presses Biden to withdraw from presidential race
item.description: Prominent Democrat Adam Schiff urged President Joe Biden to abandon his reelection bid amid controversy over a planned virtual nomination before the party conference. Schiff's call came ahead of Biden's speech to Latino voters in Nevada. Despite calls from around 20 House Democrats and one senator for Biden to withdraw, he remains resolute in his candidacy, citing polls showing a tight race with Donald Trump. The DNC faces scrutiny over plans for a virtual nomination preceding the convention.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
